FAQ.title: Still Have Questions?
FAQ.subtitle: We've gathered some of the most common questions our clients ask. Feel free to reach out to us directly if you need more information.

faq_tiles.title: Who is behind Media Control Agency?
faq_tiles.description: Media Control Agency is led by a passionate designer and developer duo with over 6+ years of experience in the industry.

faq_tiles.title: What is included in your plans?
faq_tiles.description: Our plans are comprehensive and include everything from initial concept design, website/app development, revisions, to final deployment. We ensure a seamless experience with unlimited requests, revisions, and ongoing support to bring your ideas to life.

faq_tiles.title: Why choose us over hiring a full-time designer and developer?
faq_tiles.description: Hiring us offers flexibility, expertise, and cost-efficiency. You'll gain access to a team of experienced professionals at a fraction of the cost of hiring full-time staff, without the long-term commitment. Plus, our diverse skills mean you get design, development, and strategy in one package.

faq_tiles.title: What if I'm not satisfied with the design or result?
faq_tiles.description: Your satisfaction is our priority. We offer unlimited revisions to ensure that the final design or product meets your expectations. We’ll work closely with you every step of the way to guarantee that you’re happy with the outcome.

faq_tiles.title: How quickly will I receive my project?
faq_tiles.description: We pride ourselves on efficient delivery times. Typically, we provide an average turnaround of 2-3 business days per request, with larger projects having tailored timelines. We’ll keep you informed at every stage to ensure timely completion.

faq_tiles.title: What if I only have a single request?
faq_tiles.description: No problem at all! We offer a 'Single Project' plan specifically designed for clients who have one-off design or development needs. This allows you to benefit from our expertise without committing to a long-term partnership.

faq_tiles.title: Do you offer refunds if I'm not satisfied with the service?
faq_tiles.description: We are committed to delivering high-quality results, and while refunds are not typically offered, we will work tirelessly to ensure you are satisfied with the final product. Your happiness and success are our top priorities.

terms.headline: General Terms and Conditions
paragraphs: For the initiation of business relations, the processing of orders and the execution of contracts between Media Control Agency and customers as well as potential customers (both hereinafter referred to as "Business Partners"), the following applies in addition to our privacy policy with regard to the exchange of information and data (hereinafter referred to as "Confidential Information"):

1. Media Control Agency and “Business Partners” (the "Parties") will at any time take all possible and reasonable measures to ensure information security and protection of sensitive information. The parties are obliged to secrecy in respect of the following terms (hereinafter referred to as “Terms”).

2. Media Control Agency and its “Business Partner” have an interest in sharing information, checking data and facilitating discussions. Both parties will attach great importance to the mutual protection of information and will treat it confidentially at all times.
3. “Confidential Information” includes, but is not limited to:
confidentialList: (b) information regarding personnel, customers and suppliers;
(c) inventions, processes, methods, products, patent applications and other intellectual property rights;
(d) specifications, drawings, sketches, models, samples, tools, computer programs, technical information, software codes and other corresponding or related information.
moreParagraphs: 4. Each party will mark “Confidential Information” as protected and confidential in case of doubt. In the case of information disclosed orally or in written materials that are not marked as confidential, secrecy shall only apply in cases where it is obviously a matter of secrets or insofar as the necessity for confidentiality is pointed out subsequently. Notification of the protected and confidential nature of the information may be given orally, by e-mail, in written correspondence or, if necessary, by other means of communication.

5. As soon as the receiving party ("Recipient") is informed of the proprietary and confidential nature of the “Confidential Information” disclosed by the other party, the “Recipient” shall refrain from disclosing such “Confidential Information” to other third parties without the prior written consent of the disclosing Party. The “Recipient” shall protect such “Confidential Information” from inadvertent disclosure to a third party, using the same care and diligence as it uses to protect its own proprietary and confidential information, but in no event less than reasonable care. “Recipient” shall ensure that any of its employees, officers, directors or agents who have access to the “Confidential Information” disclosed under these “Terms” are informed of its proprietary and confidential nature and are required to comply with these “Terms”. The “Recipient” of “Confidential Information” disclosed under these “Terms” shall promptly notify the disclosing party of any further disclosure of such “Confidential Information” in violation of this Agreement or of any subpoena or other legal process requiring the submission or disclosure of such “Confidential Information”. Media Control Agency is entitled to pass on “Confidential Information” to particularly trustworthy subcontractors for the processing of orders from the “Business Partner” and/or implementation/execution of the contract with the “Business Partner”. 6. All “Confidential Information” disclosed under these “Terms” shall be and remain the property of the disclosing Party, and nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to grant or transfer any rights in such “Confidential Information” to the other Party. The “Recipient” shall comply with any request by the disclosing Party to promptly return or destroy all copies of the “Confidential Information” disclosed under these “Terms” and any notes relating to “Confidential Information”.

7. Nothing in these “Terms” shall be construed to limit the right of either Party to independently develop or acquire products without using the other Party's “Confidential Information”. privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.headline: Privacy Policy of Media Control Agency
paragraphs: The following privacy policy specifies the rules for storing and accessing data on users' devices via the website, for the purpose of providing electronic services by the administrator, and the rules for collecting and processing personal data voluntarily provided by users through the tools available on the website.
This privacy policy is an integral part of the website's terms, which describe the rules, rights, and obligations of users using the website.

definitions.title: §1 Definitions
items: Service - the "Media Control Agency" website operating at https://media-control-agency.com/
External service - websites of partners, service providers, or recipients cooperating with the administrator

Website / Data Controller - The website administrator and data controller (hereinafter the administrator) is the company "Media Control Agency", located at Narcis 7, 1619 BC Andijk, with VAT number: NL004874490B47
User - a natural person to whom the administrator provides electronic services via the website.
Device - an electronic device with software that allows the user to access the website
Cookies - text data collected in the form of files placed on the user's device
GDPR - Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016
Personal data - information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person
Processing - an operation or set of operations performed on personal data
Restriction of processing - marking stored personal data to limit its processing
Profiling - automated processing of personal data to evaluate certain personal factors
Consent - voluntary, specific, informed, and unambiguous expression of will to process data
Personal data breach - a breach of security leading to destruction, loss, alteration, or unauthorized access
Pseudonymization - processing of personal data in a way that prevents identification without additional information
Anonymization - irreversible process that destroys or overwrites personal data, making identification impossible

sections.title: §2 Data Protection Officer
paragraphs: In accordance with Art. 37 of the GDPR, the administrator has not appointed a data protection officer.
For matters related to data processing, including personal data, contact the administrator directly.

sections.title: §3 Types of cookies
list: Internal cookies - files placed and read by the website's IT system on the user's device
External cookies - files placed and read by IT systems of external websites on the user's device
Session cookies - files placed and read by the website during one session on the user's device
Persistent cookies - files placed and read by the website on the user's device until manually deleted

sections.title: §4 Data Storage Security
paragraphs: The mechanisms for storing, reading, and exchanging data between cookies stored on the user's device and the website are implemented via browser mechanisms and do not collect other data from the user's device.
Internal cookie files used by the administrator are safe and do not contain scripts or malicious content.
The administrator monitors external services but does not have full control over their cookies and is not responsible for their security.
Users can manage cookie settings in their browser. Guides are available for Chrome, Firefox, Opera, Edge, Safari, and Internet Explorer.
The administrator takes measures to secure cookie data, but the user is also responsible for the security of their device.
The administrator ensures that personal data is processed securely and that access is limited and in accordance with the purpose of processing.

sections.title: §5 Purposes for which cookies are used
list: Improving and facilitating access to the website

sections.title: §6 Purposes of personal data processing
paragraphs: Personal data voluntarily provided by users is processed for:
- Provision of electronic services
- Communication between the administrator and users
- Ensuring the legitimate interest of the administrator
Anonymous data is processed for:
- Tracking statistics
- Offering personalized advertisements
- Ensuring the legitimate interest of the administrator

sections.title: §7 Cookies from external websites
paragraphs: The administrator uses scripts from partners who may place cookies. Users can manage these cookies via browser settings.
Partners include:
- Google Adsense (advertising)
- Google Analytics, WordPress Stats (statistics)
These services are beyond the administrator's control and may change their privacy policy or cookie behavior.

sections.title: §8 Types of data collected
paragraphs: The website automatically collects anonymous data and personal data voluntarily provided by users.
Anonymous data includes:
- IP address, browser type, screen resolution, location, visited subpages, operating system, previous page, referrer, language, internet speed, internet provider
Personal data includes:
- Name, email, website address, phone number, IP (collected automatically)
Newsletter data includes:
- Name, email, IP address
Some data may be stored in cookies or shared with statistics providers (without identifying users).

sections.title: §9 Access to personal data by third parties
paragraphs: In principle, only the administrator has access to personal data.
Access may be granted to service providers such as hosting companies, under a data processing agreement.
Hosting is provided by https://atthost.pl/ in Poland, with possible access for service maintenance.

sections.title: §10 Method of personal data processing
paragraphs: Personal data is not transferred outside the EU unless published by the user.
There is no profiling or sale of personal data.
Anonymous data may be transferred outside the EU and used for profiling, but is not linked to a person or sold.

sections.title: §11 Legal basis for personal data processing
§12 Retention period of personal data
paragraphs: Personal data is retained only as long as the service is active, after which it is deleted or anonymized within 30 days.
If necessary to protect legitimate interests, data may be retained for up to 3 years.
Anonymous data may be retained indefinitely for statistical purposes.

sections.title: §13 Users' rights regarding personal data processing
list: Right to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority

sections.title: §14 Contact with the administrator
list: Postal address - Media Control Agency, Narcis 7, 1619 BC Andijk, Netherlands

sections.title: §15 Website requirements
paragraphs: Restricting cookies may cause the website to malfunction.
The administrator is not responsible for problems caused by restricting cookies.

sections.title: §16 External links
paragraphs: The website may contain links to external sites not affiliated with the administrator. These may carry risks and are not the responsibility of the administrator.

sections.title: §17 Changes to the privacy policy
paragraphs: The administrator may change this privacy policy without notifying users regarding anonymous data or cookies.
Changes regarding personal data will be notified to users by email within 7 days.
Continued use implies acceptance of the changes.
Changes take effect upon publication.
